items.title: Trump says they've "got to make a deal" over Russia-Ukraine war ahead of Zelenskyy meeting
items.standfirst: President Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky are meeting at Mar-a-Lago on Sunday as they work toward a peace plan for Russia and Ukraine. Mr. Trump confirmed that he spoke with Russian President Vladimir Putin ahead of the meeting. CBS News' Jericka Duncan reports.

items.title: War in Ukraine: 'Sometimes you feel like the end is close, but every day it feels like far away'
items.standfirst: Volodymyr Zelensky is set to meet US President Donald Trump in Florida on Sunday (December 28) to discuss a 20-point peace plan aimed at ending Russia’s invasion. Ukrainian civilians are amongst those who have suffered most from Russia's war especially vulnerable populations. For more on that topic, FRANCE 24's Erin Ogunkeye is joined by Oleksii Starovierov, networks engineer at Chernihiv Rehabilitation Center for children with disabilities.
items.content: Volodymyr Zelensky is set to meet US President Donald Trump in Florida on Sunday (December 28) to discuss a 20-point peace plan aimed at ending Russia’s invasion. Ukrainian civilians are amongst those who have suffered most from Russia's war especially vulnerable populations. For more on that topic, FRANCE 24's Erin Ogunkeye is joined by Oleksii Starovierov, networks engineer at Chernihiv Rehabilitation Center for children with disabilities.

items.title: Trump and Zelenskyy to hold talks amid heavy Russian airstrikes on Ukraine
items.standfirst: Key topics include security guarantees from Europe and the US, with Putin yet to signal interest in latest negotiationsRussia-Ukraine war – latest news updatesDonald Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskyy are to meet on Sunday to discuss a plan to end the war in Ukraine, amid continuing Russian attacks on Kyiv and other Ukrainian cities, and scepticism that Moscow is willing to drop any of its maximalist demands.Zelenskyy arrived in Florida on Saturday night with a Ukrainian delegation, before talks with the US president at his Mar-a-Lago residence. The two leaders are expected to discuss the latest iteration of a 20-point peace plan and the unresolved question of the future of Ukraine’s eastern Donbas region. Continue reading...
items.content: Key topics include security guarantees from Europe and the US, with Putin yet to signal interest in latest negotiationsRussia-Ukraine war – latest news updatesDonald Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskyy are to meet on Sunday to discuss a plan to end the war in Ukraine, amid continuing Russian attacks on Kyiv and other Ukrainian cities, and scepticism that Moscow is willing to drop any of its maximalist demands.Zelenskyy arrived in Florida on Saturday night with a Ukrainian delegation, before talks with the US president at his Mar-a-Lago residence. The two leaders are expected to discuss the latest iteration of a 20-point peace plan and the unresolved question of the future of Ukraine’s eastern Donbas region. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: Russia’s “barbaric” attack on capital draws condemnation as Ukrainian leader readies for Florida meetingPower supplies to Ukraine’s capital remained patchy on Sunday after a Russian drone and missile barrage that left hundreds of thousands of people facing freezing temperatures.Ukraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, who is preparing to hold face-to-face talks on Sunday with Donald Trump, said Moscow had used nearly 500 drones and 40 missiles, including ballistic missiles, in the attack early on Saturday. items.title: Live: Trump says Ukraine war diplomacy in ‘final stages’ as he hosts Zelensky for Florida talks
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump on Sunday hosted his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelensky at his residence in Florida in a bid to broker a deal to end the near four-year Russian aggression in Ukraine. Just before the two leaders entered the meeting, Trump said the diplomacy to reach a peace deal was now in its “final stages” and that he believed Russia’s Vladimir Putin is “very serious” about ending the war. Follow our liveblog for all the latest.
items.content: US President Donald Trump on Sunday hosted his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelensky at his residence in Florida in a bid to broker a deal to end the near four-year Russian aggression in Ukraine. Just before the two leaders entered the meeting, Trump said the diplomacy to reach a peace deal was now in its “final stages” and that he believed Russia’s Vladimir Putin is “very serious” about ending the war. Follow our liveblog for all the latest.

items.title: Brigitte Bardot, 1960s French sex symbol turned militant animal rights activist, dies at 91
items.standfirst: Brigitte Bardot, the French 1960s sex symbol who became one of the greatest screen sirens of the 20th century and later a militant animal rights activist and far-right supporter, has died.
items.content: Brigitte Bardot, the French 1960s sex symbol who became one of the greatest screen sirens of the 20th century and later a militant animal rights activist and far-right supporter, has died.

items.title: Brigitte Bardot, French screen legend, dies aged 91
items.standfirst: Emmanuel Macron leads tributes to​ actor who became an international sex symbol ​and later embraced animal rights​ and far-right politicsBrigitte Bardot: a life in picturesPeter Bradshaw on Brigitte Bardot – a zeitgeist-force and France’s most sensational exportBrigitte Bardot, the French actor and singer who became an international sex symbol before turning her back on the film industry and embracing the cause of animal rights activism and far-right politics, has died aged 91.Paying tribute to Bardot on Sunday, the French president, Emmanuel Macron, wrote on social media that France was mourning “a legend of the century”. Continue reading...
items.content: Emmanuel Macron leads tributes to​ actor who became an international sex symbol ​and later embraced animal rights​ and far-right politicsBrigitte Bardot: a life in picturesPeter Bradshaw on Brigitte Bardot – a zeitgeist-force and France’s most sensational exportBrigitte Bardot, the French actor and singer who became an international sex symbol before turning her back on the film industry and embracing the cause of animal rights activism and far-right politics, has died aged 91.Paying tribute to Bardot on Sunday, the French president, Emmanuel Macron, wrote on social media that France was mourning “a legend of the century”. Continue reading...

items.title: 'She speaks to all kinds of generations': Brigitte Bardot dies aged 91
items.standfirst: French film legend Brigitte Bardot has died at 91, the Bardot foundation announced on Sunday (December 28). Bardot starred in more than 50 movies during her career before leaving the film industry to concentrate on animal rights activism. Bardot became a controversial figure in her later decades, with public comments and writing that led to five convictions for inciting hatred. For more on her career, FRANCE 24's Camille Knight is joined by Gad Edery, founder of the GADCOLLECTION gallery in Paris, that hosted an exhibition dedicated to Brigitte Bardot, a couple of years ago.
items.content: French film legend Brigitte Bardot has died at 91, the Bardot foundation announced on Sunday (December 28). Bardot starred in more than 50 movies during her career before leaving the film industry to concentrate on animal rights activism. Bardot became a controversial figure in her later decades, with public comments and writing that led to five convictions for inciting hatred. For more on her career, FRANCE 24's Camille Knight is joined by Gad Edery, founder of the GADCOLLECTION gallery in Paris, that hosted an exhibition dedicated to Brigitte Bardot, a couple of years ago.

items.title: 'She was a cultural earthquake': Brigitte Bardot dies at 91
items.standfirst: French film legend Brigitte Bardot has died at 91, the Bardot foundation announced on Sunday (December 28). Bardot starred in more than 50 movies during her career before becoming an animal rights activist and embracing far-right views. FRANCE 24's Manon Kerjean tells us more. "In her later years, Bardot became increasingly controversial due to her outspoken and radical political statements".
items.content: French film legend Brigitte Bardot has died at 91, the Bardot foundation announced on Sunday (December 28). Bardot starred in more than 50 movies during her career before becoming an animal rights activist and embracing far-right views. FRANCE 24's Manon Kerjean tells us more. "In her later years, Bardot became increasingly controversial due to her outspoken and radical political statements".

items.title: Bardot leaves controversial legacy of activism for France’s far right
items.standfirst: French cinema legend Brigitte Bardot, whose death at 91 was announced on Sunday, was well known for her status as a 1960s sex symbol. In later decades, Bardot became a militant animal rights activist and then veered to the far right, making disparaging remarks about the LGBTQ+ community, Muslims and immigrants that led to five convictions for inciting hatred.
items.content: French cinema legend Brigitte Bardot, whose death at 91 was announced on Sunday, was well known for her status as a 1960s sex symbol. In later decades, Bardot became a militant animal rights activist and then veered to the far right, making disparaging remarks about the LGBTQ+ community, Muslims and immigrants that led to five convictions for inciting hatred.

items.title: Israel becomes first country to recognise Somaliland as sovereign state
items.standfirst: Diplomatic breakthrough criticised by African Union, which said it could have ‘far-reaching implications for peace and stability across the continent’Israel has become the first country to recognise Somaliland as a sovereign state, a breakthrough in its quest for international recognition since it declared independence from Somalia 34 years ago.The Israeli foreign minister, Gideon Sa’ar, announced on Friday that Israel and Somaliland had signed an agreement establishing full diplomatic relations, which would include the opening of embassies and the appointment of ambassadors. Continue reading...
items.content: Diplomatic breakthrough criticised by African Union, which said it could have ‘far-reaching implications for peace and stability across the continent’Israel has become the first country to recognise Somaliland as a sovereign state, a breakthrough in its quest for international recognition since it declared independence from Somalia 34 years ago.The Israeli foreign minister, Gideon Sa’ar, announced on Friday that Israel and Somaliland had signed an agreement establishing full diplomatic relations, which would include the opening of embassies and the appointment of ambassadors. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: The report said that a Russian rocket sent the satellites on Sunday from a launchpad in eastern Russia.
items.content: The report said that a Russian rocket sent the satellites on Sunday from a launchpad in eastern Russia.(Image credit: Ivan Timoshenko)

items.title: Iran Says It Launched Three Satellites Into Space From Russia
items.standfirst: Iran said it sent three satellites into orbit from Russia on Sunday, a move that may intensify tensions over Tehran’s broader actions.
items.content: Iran said it sent three satellites into orbit from Russia on Sunday, a move that may intensify tensions over Tehran’s broader actions.

items.title: Bank of America CEO says the market "will punish people if we don't have an independent Fed"
items.standfirst: Bank of America Chairman and CEO Brian Moynihan said last week that, as President Trump searches for a new chair of the Federal Reserve, maintaining the banking system's independence is paramount. The market "will punish people if we don't have an independent Fed," " that was recorded on Dec. 17…

items.title: Bank of America CEO warns market "will punish people" without independent Fed
items.standfirst: Bank of America Chairman and CEO Brian Moynihan stated last week that, as President Trump seeks a new chair of the Federal Reserve, maintaining the banking system's independence is paramount.
items.content: Bank of America Chairman and CEO Brian Moynihan stated last week that, as President Trump seeks a new chair of the Federal Reserve, maintaining the banking system's independence is paramount.

items.title: Bank of America CEO says "the market will punish people if we don't have an independent Fed"
items.standfirst: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan talks prices, affordability, inflation predictions for 2026, the "shock" from the business community when President Trump enacted tariffs and how "the market will punish people if we don't have an independent Fed." Editor's note: This interview was filmed on Dec. 17, 2025.
items.content: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan talks prices, affordability, inflation predictions for 2026, the "shock" from the business community when President Trump enacted tariffs and how "the market will punish people if we don't have an independent Fed." Editor's note: This interview was filmed on Dec. 17, 2025.

clusters.title: Family pay tribute to man who died after assault outside Leicestershire pub
clusters.neutral_headline: Family pay tribute to man who died after assault outside Leicestershire pub

items.title: Family pay tribute to man who died after assault outside Leicestershire pub
items.standfirst: David Darke sustained fatal injuries in incident outside the Crown Inn in Appleby Magna, police sayThe relatives of a 66-year-old man who died days after being punched outside a village pub have paid tribute to the “devoted family man”.David Darke, who died in hospital on Saturday, was injured outside the Crown Inn in Appleby Magna, Leicestershire, on 21 December. Continue reading...

items.title: 'Devoted' dad dies after assault outside pub
items.standfirst: Police launched a murder inquiry after David Darke, 66, died in hospital days after an assault.
items.content: Police launched a murder inquiry after David Darke, 66, died in hospital days after an assault.

items.title: AI is coming for young people’s office jobs. That’s good news for the construction industry | Gene Marks
items.standfirst: While standing on the sideline watching a high school soccer game, my friend, who owned a small and successful construction company, complained that his son – a senior – was starting at a respected local university that fall, which would cost roughly $200,000 over the next four years. “I could…
items.content: While standing on the sideline watching a high school soccer game, my friend, who owned a small and successful construction company, complained that his son – a senior – was starting at a respected local university that fall, which would cost roughly $200,000 over the next four years. “I could…

items.title: AI is coming for young people’s office jobs. That’s good news for the construction industry | Gene Marks
items.standfirst: More young people are following the money and going into trades like construction where AI can’t easily replace themWhile standing on the sideline watching a high school soccer game, my friend, who owned a small and successful construction company, complained that his son – a senior – was starting at a respected local university that fall, which would cost roughly $200,000 over the next four years.“I could take the same money and set him up in a contracting business,” he said. “It would be a much better investment.” Continue reading...
items.content: More young people are following the money and going into trades like construction where AI can’t easily replace themWhile standing on the sideline watching a high school soccer game, my friend, who owned a small and successful construction company, complained that his son – a senior – was starting at a respected local university that fall, which would cost roughly $200,000 over the next four years.“I could take the same money and set him up in a contracting business,” he said. “It would be a much better investment.” Continue reading...

The Sangdong mine contains millions of tons of tungsten, known as a war metal that can withstand extraordinary…

items.title: South Korean mine could soon supply the U.S. with a critical mineral
items.standfirst: The Sangdong mine contains millions of tons of tungsten, known as a war metal that can withstand extraordinary temperatures, something the U.S. desperately needs for defense.
items.content: The Sangdong mine contains millions of tons of tungsten, known as a war metal that can withstand extraordinary temperatures, something the U.S. desperately needs for defense.

clusters.title: Cruise Ship Hits Reef on First Trip Since Passenger Death
clusters.neutral_headline: Cruise ship hits reef on first trip since leaving passenger on island

items.title: Cruise Ship Hits Reef on First Trip Since Passenger Death
items.standfirst: The Coral Adventurer cruise ship—currently under investigation after a passenger died when it left her behind on a remote island—has run aground on a reef during its first passenger voyage since the incident, almost two months ago. Why It Matters The grounding of the Coral Adventurer comes soon…
items.content: The Coral Adventurer cruise ship—currently under investigation after a passenger died when it left her behind on a remote island—has run aground on a reef during its first passenger voyage since the incident, almost two months ago. Why It Matters The grounding of the Coral Adventurer comes soon…

items.title: Cruise ship hits reef on first trip since leaving passenger on island
items.standfirst: The Coral Adventurer is under investigation for the death of Suzanne Rees, who was found dead on a remote island after being left behind by the ship.
items.content: The Coral Adventurer is under investigation for the death of Suzanne Rees, who was found dead on a remote island after being left behind by the ship.

clusters.title: Andy Carroll to appear in court after arrest and charge for breaching order

items.title: Andy Carroll to appear in court after arrest and charge for breaching order
items.standfirst: Carroll charged with breaching non-molestation orderFormer England striker due in court on TuesdayThe former England striker Andy Carroll has been charged with breaching a non-molestation order and is set to appear in court on Tuesday.Carroll, who was capped nine times by England and played for Newcastle and Liverpool, was arrested in April after allegedly committing an offence the previous month. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

items.title: Ex-England striker Carroll due in court after arrest
items.standfirst: Former Newcastle United, Liverpool and England forward Andy Carroll is due to appear in court on Tuesday after he was charged with breaching a non-molestation order.
items.content: Former Newcastle United, Liverpool and England forward Andy Carroll is due to appear in court on Tuesday after he was charged with breaching a non-molestation order.

clusters.title: Guineans vote in first presidential election since 2021 coup
clusters.neutral_headline: Guinea votes in first polls since 2021 coup, military leader likely to win

items.title: Guineans vote in first presidential election since 2021 coup
items.standfirst: Guineans are voting Sunday in the country's first election since 2021, when the head of the ruling junta, General Mamady Doumbouya, seized power in a coup d'état.
items.content: Guineans are voting Sunday in the country's first election since 2021, when the head of the ruling junta, General Mamady Doumbouya, seized power in a coup d'état.

items.title: Guinea votes in first polls since 2021 coup, military leader likely to win
items.standfirst: Mamady Doumbouya may win amid accusations of restrictions on the media and the opposition parties.
items.content: Mamady Doumbouya may win amid accusations of restrictions on the media and the opposition parties.

items.title: Video: Myanmar’s military holds first election since 2021 coup
items.standfirst: Voting is under way in Myanmar’s heavily restricted election. Tony Cheng explains the process from a polling station.
items.content: Voting is under way in Myanmar’s heavily restricted election. Tony Cheng explains the process from a polling station.

items.title: 'We will vote but not with our hearts': Inside the election staged by Myanmar's military rulers
items.standfirst: This is the first election since the army's coup in early 2021 - and it is being widely condemned as a sham.
items.content: This is the first election since the army's coup in early 2021 - and it is being widely condemned as a sham.

clusters.title: Central African Republic votes as Touadera seeks third presidential term
clusters.neutral_headline: Central African Republic votes as Touadera seeks third presidential term

items.title: Central African Republic votes as Touadera seeks third presidential term
items.standfirst: In office since 2016, President Faustin-Archange Touadera is projected to win the first round of vote.
items.content: In office since 2016, President Faustin-Archange Touadera is projected to win the first round of vote.

items.title: Central African Republic goes to polls as president seeks third term
items.standfirst: Opposition hopes to tap into frustrations of people living in country where conflict remains a daily realityCentral African Republic goes to the polls on Sunday with the president, Faustin-Archange Touadéra, seeking a third term.As many as 2.3 million registered voters will cast ballots for what observers are calling a quadruple election: votes for the presidency and parliament as well as local and municipal offices. Continue reading...
items.content: Opposition hopes to tap into frustrations of people living in country where conflict remains a daily realityCentral African Republic goes to the polls on Sunday with the president, Faustin-Archange Touadéra, seeking a third term.As many as 2.3 million registered voters will cast ballots for what observers are calling a quadruple election: votes for the presidency and parliament as well as local and municipal offices. Continue reading...
